page.title: 08Recreation and Entertainment
page.content: Most recreational activities reflect the rural character of the region. { Fishing}is popular but most local angling rights are owned by Clubs or the landowner. Shermanbury Place fisheries offer angling facilities commercially. Two regular{Gymkhanas}take place in the area. {Shooting}is also popular, for vermin, game or at two clay-pigeon shoots near Wineham.{Ferreting}is also practised. Miles of local footpaths are kept open by local{rambling}enthusiasts. An annual{County Sports Day}is held at Wineham, and the Bull Inn is the focus of an Easter Monday{marathon {walk.} The owning and riding of horses is popular, and two local fox hunts have many followers.
